uk.co.strangeskies.reflection

Class Resolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.strangeskies.reflection.Resolver

  • public class Resolver
extends java.lang.Object

    A Resolver represents a view over an underlying BoundSet, and provides a number of important functionalities for interacting with that BoundSet. Multiple Resolvers can provide different views of the same BoundSet instance.

    Whenever any InferenceVariable is created by way of a Resolver instance, that InferenceVariable will be associated with a particular GenericDeclaration. Within this context, which is so described by a GenericDeclaration, at most only one InferenceVariable may by created for any given TypeVariable. A Resolver always creates InferenceVariable according to the behaviour of incorporateTypeParameters(GenericDeclaration).

    A Resolver is a flexible and powerful tool, but for typical use-cases it may be recommended to use the more limited, but more type safe, facilities provided by the TypeToken and Invokable classes.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getBounds

        public BoundSet getBounds()
        Returns:
        The bound set backing this resolver.

      • incorporateTypeParameters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable<?>,InferenceVariable> incorporateTypeParameters(java.lang.reflect.GenericDeclaration declaration)
        Each type variable within the given GenericDeclaration, and each non-statically enclosing declaration thereof, is incorporated into the backing BoundSet. Each new InferenceVariable created in this process is registered in this Resolver under the given declaration, including those of enclosing GenericDeclarations.

        If the declaration is a non-static Executable, first the declaring class is incorporated, then the resulting inference variables are also registered under the Executable, then the type parameters of the Executable itself are registered. This means that any Executables registered within a single resolver will always share the inference variables on their declaring class with those registered directly under that class.

        Parameters:
        declaration - The declaration we wish to incorporate.
        Returns:
        A mapping from the InferenceVariables on the given declaration, to their new capturing InferenceVariables.

      • incorporateType

        public void incorporateType(java.lang.reflect.Type types)
        The given type is incorporated into the resolver, in a fashion dictated by the class of that type, as follows:
        • Class as per incorporateTypeParameters(GenericDeclaration).
        • ParameterizedType as per captureTypeArguments(ParameterizedType).
        • GenericArrayType as per incorporateType(Type) invoked for it's component type.
        • IntersectionType as per incorporateType(Type) invoked for each member.
        • WildcardType as per inferOverWildcardType(WildcardType).
        Parameters:
        types - The type we wish to incorporate.

      • inferOverWildcardType

        public InferenceVariable inferOverWildcardType(java.lang.reflect.WildcardType type)
        Incorporate a new inference variable for a given wildcard type, and add the bounds of the wildcard as bounds to the inference variable, as per the functionality of addLowerBound(Type, Type) and addUpperBound(Type, Type).
        Parameters:
        type - The wildcard type to capture as a bounded inference variable.
        Returns:
        The new inference variable created to satisfy the given wildcard.

      • addLowerBound

        public void addLowerBound(java.lang.reflect.Type type,
                          java.lang.reflect.Type lowerBound)
        Incorporate a new lower bound into the bound set. If the lower bound is a parameterized type, or if it is a wildcard or intersection type containing parameterized types, those parameters which are themselves wildcards will be replaced by inference variables.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to add the bounding to.
        lowerBound - The bounds to add to the given type.

      • addUpperBound

        public void addUpperBound(java.lang.reflect.Type type,
                          java.lang.reflect.Type upperBound)
        Incorporate a new upper bound into the bound set. If the upper bound is a parameterized type, or if it is a wildcard or intersection type containing parameterized types, those type arguments which are themselves wildcards will be replaced by inference variables.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to add the bounding to.
        upperBound - The bounds to add to the given type.

      • addLooseCompatibility

        public void addLooseCompatibility(java.lang.reflect.Type type,
                                  java.lang.reflect.Type upperBound)
        Incorporate a new loose compatibility with an upper bound into the bound set. If the upper bound is a parameterized type, or if it is a wildcard or intersection type containing parameterized types, those type arguments which are themselves wildcards will be replaced by inference variables.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to add the bounding to.
        upperBound - The bounds to add to the given type.

      • inferOverTypeArguments

        public java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType inferOverTypeArguments(java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType type)
        Add inference variables for the type parameters of the given type to the resolver, then incorporate containment constraints based on the arguments of the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose generic type arguments we wish to perform inference operations over.
        Returns:
        A parameterized type derived from the given type, with inference variables in place of wildcards where appropriate.

      • getRawType

        public java.lang.Class<?> getRawType(java.lang.reflect.Type type)
        Determine the raw type of a given type, accounting for inference variables which may have instantiations or upper bounds within the context of this resolver.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of which we wish to determine the raw type.
        Returns:
        The raw type of the given type.

      • captureTypeArguments

        public java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType captureTypeArguments(java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType type)
        Add inference variables for the type parameters of the given type to the resolver, then incorporate equality constraints to new TypeVariableCaptures for those inference variables, based on the bounds on the arguments.
        Parameters:
        type - The type whose generic type arguments we wish to capture.
        Returns:
        A parameterized type derived from the given type, with type variable captures in place of wildcards where appropriate.

      • incorporateInstantiation

        public void incorporateInstantiation(java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable<?> variable,
                                     java.lang.reflect.Type instantiation)
        Incorporate an instantiation for a type variable. In other words, find the InferenceVariable registered for the given TypeVariable under the GenericDeclaration it belongs to, and incorporate an equality bound on that inference variable to the given type.
        Parameters:
        variable - The type variable whose inference variable we wish to instantiate.
        instantiation - The type with which to instantiate the given type variable. This should be a proper type.

      • infer

        public java.util.Map<InferenceVariable,java.lang.reflect.Type> infer()
        Infer proper instantiations for each inference variable registered within this Resolver instance.
        Returns:
        A mapping from each inference variable registered under this resolver, to their newly inferred instantiations.

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • infer

        public java.lang.reflect.Type infer(java.lang.reflect.Type type)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A new type derived from the given type by substitution of instantiations for each InferenceVariable mentioned.

      • infer

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A mapping from each of the given inference variables to their inferred instantiations.

      • infer

        public java.util.Map<InferenceVariable,java.lang.reflect.Type> infer(java.util.Collection<? extends InferenceVariable> variables)
        Infer proper instantiations for the given InferenceVariables.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • incorporateTypeHierarchy

        public void incorporateTypeHierarchy(java.lang.Class<?> subclass,
                                     java.lang.Class<?> superclass)
        Any type parameters of the given subclass and superclass are incorporated into the Resolver, as are the parameters of any classes between, i.e. those classes which are a supertype of the given subclass, and a subtype of the given superclass. For each subclass in the hierarchy which provides a parameterization of a corresponding superclass, these bounds are created and incorporated.

        This has the effect, when either the given subclass or superclass are generic, of establishing any relationship the type arguments of that class may have with the other class.

        Parameters:
        subclass - A subclass of the given superclass.
        superclass - A superclass of the given subclass.

      • resolveType

        public java.lang.reflect.Type resolveType(java.lang.reflect.Type type)
        Derive a new type from the type given, with any mentioned instances of InferenceVariable and TypeVariable substituted with their proper instantiations where available, as per resolveInferenceVariable(InferenceVariable) and resolveTypeVariable(TypeVariable) respectively.
        Parameters:
        type - The type we wish to resolve.
        Returns:
        The resolved type.

      • resolveType

        public java.lang.reflect.Type resolveType(java.lang.reflect.GenericDeclaration declaration,
                                          java.lang.reflect.Type type)
        Derive a new type from the type given, with any mentioned instances of InferenceVariable and TypeVariable substituted with their proper instantiations where available, as per resolveInferenceVariable(InferenceVariable) and resolveTypeVariable(GenericDeclaration, TypeVariable) respectively.
        Parameters:
        declaration - The generic declaration whose context will provide
        type - The type we wish to resolve.
        Returns:
        The resolved type.

      • resolveTypeVariable

        public java.lang.reflect.Type resolveTypeVariable(java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable<?> typeVariable)
        Resolve the proper instantiation of a given TypeVariable if one exists. The type variable will be resolved to an InferenceVariable with respect to the context provided by its declaring class.
        Parameters:
        typeVariable - The type variable whose proper instantiation we wish to determine.
        Returns:
        The proper instantiation of the given TypeVariable if one exists, otherwise the TypeVariable itself.

      • resolveTypeVariable

        public java.lang.reflect.Type resolveTypeVariable(java.lang.reflect.GenericDeclaration declaration,
                                                  java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable<?> typeVariable)
        Resolve the proper instantiation of a given TypeVariable if one exists. The type variable will be resolved to an InferenceVariable with respect to the context provided by the given GenericDeclaration.
        Parameters:
        declaration - The GenericDeclaration under which we will check registration of the given TypeVariable.
        typeVariable - The type variable whose proper instantiation we wish to determine.
        Returns:
        The proper instantiation of the given TypeVariable if one exists, otherwise the TypeVariable itself.

      • resolveInferenceVariable

        public java.lang.reflect.Type resolveInferenceVariable(InferenceVariable variable)
        Resolve the proper instantiation of a given InferenceVariable if one exists.
        Parameters:
        variable - The inference variable whose proper instantiation we wish to determine.
        Returns:
        The proper instantiation of the given InferenceVariable if one exists, otherwise the InferenceVariable itself.

      • getInferenceVariables

        public java.util.Set<InferenceVariable> getInferenceVariables()
        Find all the inference variables which have been created through interaction with this Resolver. Note that this set of collections may only be a subset of those which would be returned by an invocation of BoundSet.getInferenceVariables() on the underlying resolver.
        Returns:
        The set of variables incorporated into this Resolver.

      • getInferenceVariables

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable<?>,InferenceVariable> getInferenceVariables(java.lang.reflect.GenericDeclaration declaration)
        Find all the inference variables registered within the context of the given GenericDeclaration. Typically this will be one for each of the TypeVariables in the declaration, and one for each TypeVariable in any non-statically enclosing classes.
        Parameters:
        declaration - The GenericDeclaration for which we will resolve inference variables.
        Returns:
        The set of variables incorporated into this Resolver under the context provided by the given declaration.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
